GUI Layout Toolbox

Version 2.4.2

GUI Layout Toolbox is a layout manager for creating MATLABÂ® graphical user interfaces that resize gracefully. The classes supplied can be used in combination to produce virtually any user interface layout.

With GUI Layout Toolbox, you can:

  • Arrange MATLAB user interface components horizontally, vertically, or in grids
  • Mix fixed and variable-sized components
  • Resize components interactively by dragging dividers
  • Show and hide components using tabs and panels
  • Show part of a large component in a scrollable panel

GUI Layout Toolbox supports figure (Java graphics system) from R2014b, and uifigure (JavaScript graphics system) from R2022a ğŸ‰.

This toolbox was created by David Sampson and Ben Tordoff from the Consulting Services group at MathWorks.

Contents

  • Get Started with GUI Layout Toolbox: Introductory notes and installation instructions
  • Understanding Layouts: Describes the purpose and overall design of the layout tools
  • Positioning Axes: How to include axes, legends, and colorbars in layouts
  • Controlling Visibility: Controlling visibility of components within layouts
  • Working with Box Panels: Equipping panels with context help, minimize/maximize or undock/dock capability
  • Working with Scrolling Panels: Arranging a single element inside a panel with horizontal and vertical scrollbars
  • Layout Interoperability: Using GUI Layout Toolbox layouts with MATLAB's layout managers, App Designer, and GUIDE
  • Building a Complete Application: Build a complete application using toolbox layouts
  • Reference: A list of all classes and functions
